actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 102-633, Part I.
Mr. Guarini moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed until July 8.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Failed by the Yeas and Nays (2/3 required): 173 - 243 (Roll No. 276).

official_title: Relating to the use of unobligated moneys in the Customs Forfeiture Fund.
subjects: Treatment and rehabilitation of narcotic addicts

summary.as: Reported to House amended, Part I
summary.text: Amends the Tariff Act of 1930 to authorize the use of certain excess unobligated amounts in the Customs Forfeiture Fund for each fiscal year after FY 1991 by the Department of Health and Human Services for: (1) drug treatment for individuals under criminal justice supervision; and (2) relief to hospital trauma care centers for uncompensated emergency health care.

titles.title: Relating to the use of unobligated moneys in the Customs Forfeiture Fund.
